overview_summary: None of these four Selkirk neighbors has a documented public stance for or against local development projects. All remain low-profile residents without notable positions of civic influence, as none hold public office or lead community initiatives.

neighbors.name: Jason S. Mantor
neighbors.claims: Jason S. Mantor owns property in the Selkirk area of the town of Bethlehem, Albany County ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Development-moratorium-could-jeopardize-16666817.php#:~:text=Selkirk%20Reserve%20is%20the%20town%E2%80%99s,state%20may%20pull%20its%20funding)). His name does not appear in town board minutes or in local news reports about recent development debates ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)). There is no public record of Mantor taking a position on nearby projects and he has not been identified with any civic roles or community statements to date ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Mantor in a neighborly, informal way. A project representative familiar with Selkirk should reach out to listen to any concerns he may have, providing clear information and emphasizing respect for the local community’s quality of life.

neighbors.name: Vladimir Kolodiychik
neighbors.claims: Vladimir Kolodiychik is the owner of a residence on Jericho Road in Selkirk, near the site of a proposed 72-unit affordable housing project off Route 9W (the Selkirk Reserve) ([www.change.org](https://www.change.org/p/bethlehem-town-board-deny-the-selkirk-reserve-moratorium-waiver#:~:text=The%20Bethlehem%20Town%20Board%20will,of%209W%20near%20Jericho%20Road)). During public discussions of that project, Selkirk neighbors (not named individually) voiced concerns about traffic and asserted their community was already diverse enough without new development ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Selkirk-Reserve-granted-waiver-from-development-16688085.php#:~:text=But%20others%20%E2%80%94%20particularly%20Selkirk,be%20situated%20off%20Route%209W)). Kolodiychik has no documented statements in local media or records, indicating he has not publicly taken a stance on development plans ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)). He holds no known public office or leadership positions in the community ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a local liaison reach out to Mr. Kolodiychik, acknowledging the quiet rural character of Jericho Road. Emphasize listening to any worries about traffic or community impacts, and explain how the project will address infrastructure and preserve neighborhood character.

neighbors.name: Rachel Hegeman
neighbors.claims: Rachel Hegeman owns property along Jericho Road in Selkirk, in the vicinity of the planned Selkirk Reserve housing development ([www.change.org](https://www.change.org/p/bethlehem-town-board-deny-the-selkirk-reserve-moratorium-waiver#:~:text=The%20Bethlehem%20Town%20Board%20will,of%209W%20near%20Jericho%20Road)). Like many other Selkirk residents, she has not publicly commented on local development proposals, and there is no mention of her in town meeting records or news coverage of the debates ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)). Hegeman is not listed in any official capacity in Bethlehem’s government or civic organizations, suggesting she is a private resident without an active public profile ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Ms. Hegeman with a respectful, one-on-one conversation. Given her low public profile, a personal visit by a community relations representative could help build trust. Emphasize understanding her perspective as a long-time local resident and address any questions about how the project will maintain the area’s rural atmosphere.

neighbors.name: Ralf K. Kiehl
neighbors.claims: Dr. Ralf K. Kiehl is a Selkirk landowner who works as a radiologist in the Albany region ([www.healthlynked.com](https://www.healthlynked.com/doctor/ralf-k-kiehl/#:~:text=)). He owns a parcel in Bethlehem but has not been identified in any local planning or zoning meetings, and no public comments from him about development have been reported ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)). Kiehl does not serve in any local governmental or advisory roles, indicating he has minimal direct influence on community decisions beyond that of a private resident ([spotlightnews.com](https://spotlightnews.com/news/government/2021/05/19/residents-fear-affordable-housing-plan-wont-succeed-at-its-proposed-selkirk-location/#:~:text=Town%20Board%20members%20spent%20nearly,within%20the%20RCS%20school%20district)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dr. Kiehl via a data-driven discussion, as he is a science professional. It may be effective to have a subject matter expert (for example, an engineer or environmental specialist) discuss the project’s safety and impact mitigation with him, addressing any technical questions he might have.
